00064 sub pretty_print_rh { 
00065     shift if UNIVERSAL::isa($_[0] => __PACKAGE__);
00066     my $rh = shift;
00067     my $indent = shift || 0;
00068 
00069     my $out = "";
00070     return $out if $indent>10;
00071     my $type = ref($rh);
00072 
00073     if (defined($type) and $type) {
00074         $out .= " type = $type; ";
00075     } elsif ($rh == undef) {
00076         $out .= " type = scalar; ";
00077     }
00078     if ( ref($rh) =~/HASH/ or "$rh" =~/HASH/ ) {
00079         $out .= "{\n";
00080         $indent++;
00081         foreach my $key (sort keys %{$rh})  {
00082             $out .= "  "x$indent."$key => " . pretty_print_rh( $rh->{$key}, $indent ) . "\n";
00083         }
00084         $indent--;
00085         $out .= "\n"."  "x$indent."}\n";
00086 
00087     } elsif (ref($rh)  =~  /ARRAY/ or "$rh" =~/ARRAY/) {
00088         $out .= " ( ";
00089         foreach my $elem ( @{$rh} )  {
00090             $out .= pretty_print_rh($elem, $indent);
00091         
00092         }
00093         $out .=  " ) \n";
00094     } elsif ( ref($rh) =~ /SCALAR/ ) {
00095         $out .= "scalar reference ". ${$rh};
00096     } elsif ( ref($rh) =~/Base64/ ) {
00097         $out .= "base64 reference " .$$rh;
00098     } else {
00099         $out .=  $rh;
00100     }
00101     
00102     return $out." ";
00103 }

00117 sub format_hash_ref {
00118     my $hash = shift;
00119     my $out_str="";
00120     my $count =4;
00121     foreach my $key ( sort keys %$hash) {
00122         my $value = defined($hash->{$key})? $hash->{$key}:"--";
00123         $out_str.= " $key=>$value ";
00124         $count--;
00125         unless($count) { $out_str.="\n  ";$count =4;}
00126     }
00127     $out_str;
00128 }

00134 sub initiate_session {
00135     my ($invocant, @args) = @_;
00136     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00137     ######### trace commands ######
00138         my @caller = caller(1);  # caller data
00139         my $calling_function = $caller[3];
00140         #print STDERR  "\n\nWebworkWebservice.pm ".__LINE__." initiate_session called from $calling_function\n";
00141     ###############################
00142     
00143     my $rh_input     = $args[0];
00144     # print STDERR "input from the form is ", format_hash_ref($rh_input), "\n";
00145     
00146     # obtain input from the hidden fields on the HTML page
00147     my $user_id      = $rh_input ->{userID};
00148     my $session_key  = $rh_input ->{session_key};
00149     my $courseName   = $rh_input ->{courseID};
00150     my $password     = $rh_input ->{password};
00151     my $ce           = $class->create_course_environment($courseName);
00152     my $db           = new WeBWorK::DB($ce->{dbLayout});
00153     
00154     my $language= $ce->{language} || "en";
00155     my $language_handle = WeBWorK::Localize::getLoc($language) ;
00156 
00157     my $user_authen_module = WeBWorK::Authen::class($ce, "user_module");
00158     runtime_use $user_authen_module;
00159     
00160 if ($UNIT_TESTS_ON) {
00161     print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pl ".__LINE__." site_password  is " , $rh_input->{site_password},"\n";
00162     print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pl ".__LINE__." courseID  is " , $rh_input->{courseID},"\n";
00163     print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pl ".__LINE__." userID  is " , $rh_input->{userID},"\n";
00164     print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pl ".__LINE__." session_key  is " , $rh_input->{session_key},"\n";
00165 }    
00166 
00167 #   This structure needs to mimic the structure expected by Authen
00168     my $self = {
00169         courseName  =>  $courseName,
00170         user_id     =>  $user_id,
00171         password    =>  $password,
00172         session_key =>  $session_key,
00173         ce          =>  $ce,
00174         db          =>  $db,
00175         language_handle => $language_handle,
00176     };  
00177     $self = bless $self, $class;
00178     # need to bless self before it can be used as an argument for the authentication module
00179     # The authentication module is expecting a WeBWorK::Request object
00180     # But its only actual requirement is that the method maketext() is defined.
00181     
00182     my $authen = $user_authen_module->new($self);
00183     my $authz  =  WeBWorK::Authz->new($self);
00184     
00185     $self->{authen}             = $authen;
00186     $self->{authz}              = $authz;
00187     
00188      
00189     if ($UNIT_TESTS_ON) {
00190        print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pm ".__LINE__." initiate data:\n  "; 
00191        print STDERR  "class type is ", $class, "\n";
00192        print STDERR  "Self has type ", ref($self), "\n";
00193        print STDERR   "self has data: \n", format_hash_ref($self), "\n";
00194     }
00195 #   we need to trick some of the methods within the webwork framework 
00196 #   since we are not coming in with a standard apache request
00197 #   FIXME:  can/should we change this????
00198 #
00199 #   We are borrowing tricks from the AuthenWeBWorK.pm module
00200 #
00201 #   
00202 
00203     # now, here's the problem... WeBWorK::Authen looks at $r->params directly, whereas we
00204     # need to look at $user and $sent_pw. this is a perfect opportunity for a mixin, i think.
00205     my $authenOK;
00206     eval {
00207         no warnings 'redefine';
00208         local *WeBWorK::Authen::get_credentials   = \&WebworkXMLRPC::get_credentials;
00209         local *WeBWorK::Authen::maybe_send_cookie = \&WebworkXMLRPC::noop;
00210         local *WeBWorK::Authen::maybe_kill_cookie = \&WebworkXMLRPC::noop;
00211         local *WeBWorK::Authen::set_params        = \&WebworkXMLRPC::noop;
00212         local *WeBWorK::Authen::write_log_entry   = \&WebworkXMLRPC::noop; # maybe fix this to log interactions FIXME
00213         $authenOK = $authen->verify;
00214     } or do {
00215         if (Exception::Class->caught('WeBWorK::DB::Ex::TableMissing')) {
00216             # was asked to authenticate into a non-existent course
00217             die SOAP::Fault
00218                 ->faultcode('404')
00219                 ->faultstring('Course not found.')
00220         }
00221         die "Unknown exception when trying to verify authentication.";
00222     };
00223     
00224     $self->{authenOK}  = $authenOK;
00225     $self->{authzOK}   = $authz->hasPermissions($user_id, "access_instructor_tools");
00226     
00227 # Update the credentials -- in particular the session_key may have changed.
00228     $self->{session_key} = $authen->{session_key};
00229 
00230     if ($UNIT_TESTS_ON) {
00231         print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pm ".__LINE__." authentication for ",$self->{user_id}, " in course ", $self->{courseName}, " is = ", $self->{authenOK},"\n";
00232         print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pm ".__LINE__."authorization as instructor for ", $self->{user_id}, " is ", $self->{authzOK},"\n"; 
00233         print STDERR  "WebworkWebservice.pm ".__LINE__." authentication contains ", format_hash_ref($authen),"\n";
00234         print STDERR   "self has new data \n", format_hash_ref($self), "\n";
00235     } 
00236  # Is there a way to transmit a number as well as a message?
00237  # Could be useful for nandling errors.
00238     die "Could not authenticate user $user_id with key $session_key " unless $self->{authenOK};
00239     die "User $user_id does not have professor privileges in this course $courseName " unless $self->{authzOK};
00240     return $self;
00241 }

00251 sub create_course_environment {
00252     my $self = shift;
00253     my $courseName = shift;
00254     my $ce = WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment->new( 
00255                 {webwork_dir        =>      $WebworkWebservice::WW_DIRECTORY, 
00256                  courseName         =>      $courseName
00257                  });
00258     #warn "Unable to find environment for course: |$courseName|" unless ref($ce);
00259     return ($ce);
00260 }

00289 sub get_credentials {
00290         my $self = shift;
00291         # self is an Authen object it contains an object r which is the WebworkXMLRPC object
00292         # confusing isn't it?
00293         $self->{user_id}     = $self->{r}->{user_id};
00294         $self->{session_key} = $self->{r}->{session_key};
00295         $self->{password}    = $self->{r}->{password}; #"the-pass-word-can-be-provided-via-a-pop-up--call-back";
00296         $self->{login_type}  = "normal";
00297         $self->{credential_source} = "params";
00298         return 1;
00299 }

00309 sub do {   # process and return result
00310            # make sure that credentials are returned
00311            # for every call
00312            # $result -> xmlrpcCall(command, in);
00313            # $result->{output}->{foo} is defined for foo = courseID userID and session_key
00314     my $self = shift;
00315     my $result = shift;
00316     $result->{session_key}  = $self->{session_key};
00317     $result->{userID}       = $self->{user_id};
00318     $result->{courseID}     = $self->{courseName};
00319     return($result);
00320 }

00542 
00543 sub is_hash_ref {
00544     my $in =shift;
00545     my $save_SIG_die_trap = $SIG{__DIE__};
00546     $SIG{__DIE__} = sub {CORE::die(@_) };
00547     my $out = eval{  %{   $in  }  };
00548     $out = ($@ eq '') ? 1 : 0;
00549     $@='';
00550     $SIG{__DIE__} = $save_SIG_die_trap;
00551     $out;
00552 }
00553 sub is_array_ref {
00554     my $in =shift;
00555     my $save_SIG_die_trap = $SIG{__DIE__};
00556     $SIG{__DIE__} = sub {CORE::die(@_) };
00557     my $out = eval{  @{   $in  }  };
00558     $out = ($@ eq '') ? 1 : 0;
00559     $@='';
00560     $SIG{__DIE__} = $save_SIG_die_trap;
00561     $out;
00562 }
00563 sub filterObject {
00564 
00565     my $is_hash = 0;
00566     my $is_array =0;
00567     my $obj = shift;
00568     #print "Enter filterObject ", ref($obj), "\n";
00569     my $type = ref($obj);
00570     unless ($type) {
00571         #print "leave filterObject with nothing\n";
00572         return($obj);
00573     }
00574 
00575 
00576     if ( is_hash_ref($obj)  ) {
00577         #print "enter hash ", %{$obj},"\n";
00578         my %obj_container= %{$obj};
00579         foreach my $key (keys %obj_container) {
00580             $obj_container{$key} = filterObject( $obj_container{$key} );
00581             #print $key, "  ",  ref($obj_container{$key}),"   ", $obj_container{$key}, "\n";
00582         }
00583         #print "leave filterObject with HASH\n";
00584         return( bless(\%obj_container,'HASH'));
00585     };
00586 
00587 
00588 
00589     if ( is_array_ref($obj)  ) {
00590         #print "enter array ( ", @{$obj}," )\n";
00591         my @obj_container= @{$obj};
00592         foreach my $i (0..$#obj_container) {
00593             $obj_container[$i] = filterObject( $obj_container[$i] );
00594             #print "\[$i\]  ",  ref($obj_container[$i]),"   ", $obj_container[$i], "\n";
00595         }
00596         #print "leave filterObject with ARRAY\n";
00597         return( bless(\@obj_container,'ARRAY'));
00598     };
00599     
00600 }
00601 
00602 
00603 1;
